results.title: How ‘Candyman’ Star Yahya Abdul-Mateen II Became the Next Big Name
results.abstract: The actor’s career has surged thanks to projects like “Aquaman” and “Watchmen.” He’s even become a Warner Bros. favorite. Now on the brink of movie stardom, he’s ready to steer.

multimedia.caption: “Sometimes it’s like, ‘Look, man, I want to get off the wave and create my own,’” Yahya Abdul Mateen II said.

results.title: Cartier Joins the Sponsors of the Venice Film Festival
results.abstract: As part of the agreement, the Paris high jewelry house will present an annual award, with the first going to the director Ridley Scott.

results.title: Lisa Joy on ‘Reminiscence,’ ‘Westworld’ and the Lure of Techno-Noir
results.abstract: The writer-director says she is obsessed with time. One way to have more of it is “to create whole new timelines and dimensions.”

multimedia.caption: When she first pitched “Reminiscence,” Lisa Joy said, she was “heavily pregnant” and people would ask, “What the hell is wrong with you? Why are you writing this mysterious, dark, violent, sexy thing?”
multimedia.copyright: Tracy Nguyen for The New York Times

results.title: Joe Galloway, Decorated Vietnam War Correspondent, Dies at 79
results.abstract: He chronicled the first major battle of the war in “We Were Soldiers Once … and Young” and raised questions about the invasion of Iraq.
des_facet: We Were Soldiers Once ... and Young: Ia Drang -- The Battle That Changed the War in Vietnam (Book)

multimedia.caption: The longtime war correspondent Joe Galloway in 2017. He chronicled the first major battle in the Vietnam War; his reporting later called into question the rationale for America’s invasion of Iraq in 2003.
multimedia.copyright: Todd J. Van Emst/Opelika-Auburn News, via Associated Press
